title: Power - variable R at constant V and at constant I

content.question: Two different circuits each contain a variable resistor and either a voltmeter or an ammeter, as shown in the figure. Each circuit also contains a variable power supply, which is not shown. In Circuit <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, the power supply maintains a constant potential difference across the resistor as the resistance is changed. In Circuit <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, the power supply is adjusted to keep the current in the resistor constant as the resistance is changed. If the resistance is increased for both resistors, in which circuit(s), if either, will the power dissipated by the resistor increase as well?

choices.label: Circuit <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> only
Circuit <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> only

content.answer: Circuit <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> only

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
